text:
The documentation located at http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/core.html#loglevel states:
'When logging to a regular file messages of the level notice cannot be suppressed and thus are always logged. However, this doesn't apply when logging is done using syslog.'

Output I want to suppress for example:
[Sun Mar 27 19:46:24 2011] [notice] Graceful restart requested, doing restart
[Sun Mar 27 19:46:24 2011] [notice] Apache/2.2.9 (Debian) mod_ssl/2.2.9 OpenSSL/0.9.8o configured -- resuming normal operations

This seems like a bug to me. Is it going to be resolved?
creator: me@woet.me
